column5: I know New Brunswick has some trophy striped bass. Any suggestion where I should go and what time should i go for it ? Thanks guys!
they do but you have hit them at the right time of the year i was looking into it a while ago they in rivers in spring and fall

world class stripers runnin' thru the mighty saint john river . never fished for them myself but  "fishin' canada ", well pete,  did a show on stripers . dig into  their web site ,, i'm sure you'll get all you need right down to the gps locations. not sure of the web address ,, maybe some OFC'er can help with that . it's been a while since that show aired ,, good luck.
Thank you Waterwolf! I will try to google more information!
i was going to go to P.E.I for them
i'm not 100%,,  but didn't the record come out of the bay of fundy at 60 odd pounds ??  let that set the tempo ,guys.
Not sure about NB, but we have a good run here in Nova Scotia. (I guess they gotta pass NB before teh get to NS though)  This 57lber was caught last year.
Yeah im with that not sure about NB but NS for sure 6 of 1 half a dozen of the other though THEY LOVE EELS!!!!!!

If you're looking for NB Striper fishing, here are some of the threads on the NB Fishing Discussion Board that have been running for some time.  This is a L O N G one...  http://www.newbrunswickfishing.com/forum/t...p;id_topic=3456  This one is for spring fishing and is somewhat shorter.  http://www.newbrunswickfishing.com/forum/t...p;id_topic=3552  This is another fairly one but has some good GPS coordinates for launching a boat.  http://www.newbrunswickfishing.com/forum/t...p;id_topic=3519  Bring your HEAVY tackle as these puppies are big and mean   Hope that Helps  David  aka  Superdad ex NBer
Yeah, but the folks are nicer,the beer's better, and the girls prettier, in Scotia
Thanks a lot David, it's very helpful!  I will read more about it!
